body:

title: [$250] Add report columns

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from [this issue](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/71821), we want to add specific columns to `type:expense-report`, as follows: Displaying type:expense-report results Add default report column headers: - Created - Status - Title - From - To - Total - Action Default sort column: - “Created” (newest > oldest) - Allow all columns to be clicked to sort.

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** **Reproducible in production?:** **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @cead22 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761674838742469) ## Action Performed: Issue Summary: The UpdateWorkspaceMembersRole command is being called with an empty employees array ([]). While the exact reproduction steps are unclear, logs confirm it is occurring in production. ## Expected Result: UpdateWorkspaceMembersRole should not be called with an empty employees array. The request should be blocked, ignored, or validated client-side before being sent. ## Actual Result: The command is sometimes executed with: employees: [] Affected app versions: 9.2.38-0 [(Logs)](https://www.expensify.com/_devportal/tools/logSearch/#query=request_id%3A%22993b6b8bfa819a6e-LAX%22&engine=elasticsearch) 9.2.33-4[ (Logs)](https://www.expensify.com/_devportal/tools/logSearch/#query=request_id:(%2299192353d96ed6d5-LAX%22)&index=_all&engine=elasticsearch) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

## Screenshots/Videos
Add any screenshot/video evidence

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176668/test-cases/41236630, https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176668/test-cases/41236632 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.6.1 Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com in incognito window. Set the cookies: lc-debug = 1; lc-qa = 2, refresh the page 1. Sign up with a new user, use gmail address without a + 2. On the onboarding select "Manage my team's expenses" - 1-10, any accounting software 3. Verify there's a last modal to ask the user "How would you like to get started" with the options "Take a test drive" and "Explore all features" ## Expected Result: "How would you like to get started" modal is displayed at the end of the onboarding flow ## Actual Result: "How would you like to get started" modal is not displayed at the end of the onboarding flow, only "Take a test drive" modal ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c723aeab-7a31-479f-87a0-9c244414b1ea [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.39-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** retesting https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/528139 https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176670/test-cases/41237109 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Slottwo1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 phone **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1.Open the Expensify app. 2.Open any workspace chat. 3.Submit two expenses to it. (One of them, has to be distance expense) 4.Open the report of the just created expenses. 5.Tap on "More" 6.Delete the report 7.Return to LHN. 8.Note that the preview of the distance expense report, it now shows correctly. 9.Open Self DM. 10.Note that expenses are now displayed on that chat 11. Note distance receipt is displayed with empty space 12. Open the distance expense Note that "Distance" field is displayed correctly, ## Expected Result: In "Rate" field, "Rate out of policy" error must be shown. ## Actual Result: In "Rate" field, "Rate out of policy" error is not shown. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/44735f53-7ab3-4e2f-b1b6-cdb4edfa87e6 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.39-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72913 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+new264@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Android 16 / Pixel 7A/ Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Admin Invite: Member 1, 2, 3 - Add approval workflow: Member 1 submit to Member 2, Member 3 is second approver - Member 1 submit an expense to Workspace 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Log in as Member 2, Navigate to Member 1 Workspace chat 3. Open the expense report 4. Approve the report 5. Log out Member 2 6. Log in as Member 3 7. Navigate to Member 1 Workspace chat 8. Open the expense report ## Expected Result: When approver open the submitter's expense report, next step is displayed correctly ## Actual Result: Next step is not displayed when approver firstly open the report after login. Navigate away and back, approver can view the next step. Issue happens with admin also. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d53778a-a919-46b0-a848-fd235b5fa114 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
